item.name: State of matter
item.desc: Form of a substance; dsependant on form stability and whether it takes up a definite volume: solid, liquid or gaseous. [img]e.png[/img]

item.name: Chemical Symbol
item.desc: One, two, or three letter abbreviation; set through international convention.

item.name: Chromatography
item.desc: Matter separation in a moving medium (mobile Phase) through differentiated absorbtion on a static medium (stationary phase).

item.name: Distillation
item.desc: Separation of a liquid solution (homogenous mix) into its component through evaporation and condensation. In a fractionary distillation the process is repeated several times in a column.

item.name: Element
item.desc: Matter that can't be broken down into simpler matter. Chemical elements are cornerstones of Materials. Elements consist of atoms that consist of a nucleus of positive protons and neutral neutrons and a shell of electrons.

item.name: Emulsion
item.desc: Heterogenous mix of two liquids.

item.name: Extraction
item.desc: Processing a homogenous or heterogenous mix to get pure matter.

item.name: Filtering
item.desc: Separation of a solid matter from a liquid matter or gaseous matter with a filter (porous seperation wall).

item.name: Mix
item.desc: Matter consisting of differentiated matter, combined in non-set ratios. [i]Homogenous mixes[/i] have a coherent look, [i]heterogenous mixes[/i] consist of multiple phases.

item.name: Accuracy
item.desc: Consisting of accidental and systematic errors.

item.name: Law of Mass Preservation
item.desc: During a chemical reaction mass is neither lost nor gained. The sum mass of the material going into the reaction equals the sum of the mass of the products of the reaction.

item.name: Law of constant proportions
item.desc: An alloy always contains the same elements in the same mass ration. Should two or more elements bind together then the mass ratio is constant.

item.name: Crystalization
item.desc: Separation of solid, crystallic matter from a solution, or the liquid or gaseous phases.

item.name: Solution
item.desc: Homogenous mix of multiple pure materials

item.name: Mass
item.desc: Measurement of an ammount of matter.

item.name: Matter
item.desc: All that takes up space andhas mass.

item.name: Phase
item.desc: Through chemical composition and physical attributes homogenous portion of matter, that separated from its environment in its expantion through a surface.

item.name: Precision
item.desc: Expressed through standard deviation: Values given over accidental errors.

item.name: Correctness
item.desc: Values given over accidental errors.

item.name: SI-Unit
item.desc: Measurement unit using International Symbols.

item.name: Significant Point
item.desc: The amount of numbers in a number that are enumeration-worthy.

item.name: Standard deviation
item.desc: An amount with which the precision of a measurement can be estimates.

item.name: Suspension
item.desc: Heterogenous mix consisting of a liquid and solid matter.

item.name: Alloys
item.desc: Pure matter consisting of multiple elements in a set ratio.

item.name: Alpha rays
item.desc: Rays consisting of alpha particles, consisting of two protons and two neutrons that are emitted from the Atoms of certain radioactive elements.

item.name: Atom
item.desc: Atoms are chemically unseparatable and building blocks of matter. Atoms of one kind are alled Element.

item.name: Atomic nucleus
item.desc: The small, positively-charged center of an Atom, in which Protons and Neutrons are found.

item.name: Atomic Mass
item.desc: Mass of an atom, taken on a scale where the the mass of the Atom C 12u is. In elements that consist of different isotopes the mid-range mass of the isotope mix is given.

item.name: Beta rays
item.desc: Rays consisting of electrons that are emitted from Atoms of radioactive elements.
